description:
I am giving Krua Thai a well deserved review update. Since it is the closest restaurant to my house, I have visited it a lot in the past few months. Sometimes for takeout, and sometimes to dine in. The takeout is always ready very quickly- and if for some reason it isn't, they will bring you a glass of water and let you sit at a table while you wait, which is not necessary but is very nice. 

My favorite thing on the menu is by far the green curry. It's spicy, flavorful, creamy, and full of crunchy fresh vegetables. I always get it with tofu, and they are generous with how much tofu they put inside. I also really, really like the drunken noodles. The portion size is very reasonable and can last for a couple of meals, for a decent price. The Krua special Crispy Chicken is extremely delicious as well, although a bit dry, so I would recommend having that with a curry or something more vegetable heavy and moist. 

Overall, I have really been impressed by Krua Thai lately, and felt that I should update my review. This is quickly becoming one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the area!
author: Ayushi A.

description:
We happened to have stumbled upon this place while we were waiting to get our tattoos. But now, every time I'm in the area, I make my way here. 

Their service is A+. Quick, friendly and accommodating. My wife was on crutches our first time and they allowed us to prop up her leg with pillows. 

The food is A+. I'm a traditional person, so I stick with what I know, usually. However, the last two times, I've tried something new on the menu and everything has been delicious! Mild yellow curry- yum! Drunken Noodles with duck or chicken - yum! Sangria - yum! SAMOSAS - YUUUUUM! 

I am a fan!!!
author: Marjorie J.

description:
I made a reservation for 10 people, through OpenTable. I showed up to find that Krua Thai is now closed on Wednesdays, as of a few weeks ago. What? Why did they let OpenTable book a reservation, if they were going to be closed? Why did I go through the reservation confirmation step if the restaurant wasn't even going to be open? Why didn't they check to see what reservations were coming through for days that they planned to close, and let me know? 

It's a massive inconvenience to show up with 10 people and then have to last minute find another restaurant and make sure that everyone gets there; that's why we made a reservation at this restaurant. This is so lame and unprofessional.
author: Steve P.

description:
Good food, good service, good vibes. Came around dinner time on a Saturday early evening with a group of 8 people and we were seated right away. Our servers seemed very happy to see us and was very welcoming. The interior is beautiful and has a nice modern aesthetic. I don't usually comment on bathrooms, but it was one of the nicest restaurant bathrooms I've seen in a while. There was also this huge candle that smelled so nice.

I split the Crab Fried Rice with a friend, which was pretty good. Never had crab in my fried rice but I'm here for it now. Everyone at my table seemed to be really happy with their choices. Will definitely keep this place in mind the next time I'm in SF!
author: Josh B.

description:
We were out and about in The Mission and realized that we all desired Thai for dinner. We were able to score a reservation for 3 at Krua with ease. 

The dining room was almost full early on a Saturday night. The decor and ambiance is relaxed and basic- not stuffy or trendy. The food and service are the stars here. 

We ordered egg rolls and a bottle of wine to start our table off with. Our server was attentive and quick. We ordered three dishes to share family style, which came in a timely fashion. The green beans, pineapple rice, and drunken noodles were excellent! The beans were cooked to perfection and not drenched in oil. The rice was flavorful and the noodles were chewy and satisfying.

We cleaned our plates and vowed to add Krua to our dinner rotation list!
author: Andrea H.

description:
We started with the Krua Sampler for $11.95
It's a combination of two crispy egg rolls, two Golden Bags, two curry samosas, and four fried shum.  This is enough for two people and a nice way to start things off with a cold Singha beer!  A small cucumber salad and a side of soy sauce come with the Sampler.
I then chose from the "Sautéed" section of the menu and ordered the
Broccoli (Chinese/American broccoli).   This dish included sautéed broccoli with carrots, baby corn, and mushrooms in a light brown sauce.
I added chicken and prawns.  Jasmine rice was the accompaniment.
It was light, flavorful and quite healthy.  I wished there was a bit more sauce that was served so I could soak up the rice. 

Service was great and the restaurant was very clean.  There is an extensive menu of traditional Thai plates.   The prices are affordable too!
author: Thomas D.

description: We went here with a large party on a weekend, but the place wasn't too crowded. We got some of the curry and the appetizer sampler - both of which were great. I liked the customer service the best, our waiter was willing to bring us different things and serve us multiple times because we were having a lot of trouble making decisions. Eventually the food was in great portions and tasted great as well. I would definitely come back here, the service was amazing and the food was great.
author: Akshay P.

description: I was pretty happy with this place. I called 1/2 hour before I wanted to make a reservation for 12 people on a Saturday and they still agreed to accomodate us! We ordered a ton of stuff - I liked the thai iced tea even though no one has boba these days. We also got the appetizer sampler, which was pretty good especially the sauces. We got the chicken wings which I didn't like too much but they were worth a shot and others liked them. For our side of the table we got a pad see ew, and green chicken curry. They were both delicious! I'd definitely come back if I were in the area.
author: Apoorva D.

description:
I came here for what was supposed to be a quick, easygoing dinner as I love Thai food and I like to treat myself to it after a long day's of work sometimes. Instead, what I experienced at Krua Thai left me annoyed and unhappy with both the food and the service. 

For a Monday night, they were pretty busy but they chose to only have two servers for the entire restaurant.
Right away, when I walked in, I knew my boyfriend and I were in trouble when they shoved us in the back corner of the restaurant. Soon, they forgot about us and I had to try to flag them down multiple times to get my food order in. Even after I placed my order, they forgot to ask me for water and walked away. I was super thirsty but by the time I realized that they didn't provide water, it was too late. The server walked away. Again, more attempts to flag them down.

When our appetizer came out, it was a small bowl of prawn Tom Yum soup. I was very disappointed in the soup as it costs $7.50 for a small, one person bowl that contained three small mushrooms (sliced- not whole) and three prawns. The broth itself was not good- it was bland compared to other Tom Yum soups I've had in my life.

After we ate our soup, we continued to wait for another 20 minutes before they showed up with two entrees- both were NOT what we ordered. They realized that they gave us the order for another table and walked away. I soon realized that the food they brought out was served for a table that placed their orders after ours. I was a little peeved about this fact but I was willing to let it go as I thought my food was coming out soon. NOPE. It took another 15 minutes of waiting and waiting before I finally flagged them down at least twice requesting the status of our food. One of the younger, more inexperienced female servers simply nodded when I asked her about the status and walked away without a follow up. Finally, the more experienced server saw me waving at her and went back to the kitchen to find out the status of our dishes.

Our food finally came out 45 minutes after our initial order- which some of you may think is not long, but when you consider the fact that my boyfriend and I ordered the most basic food to make at Thai restaurants- fried rice and Pad Thai- you would be pretty upset too.

When we finally had the chance to eat our fried rice and Pad Thai, we were sorely disappointed at the quality of food. Both dishes were bland, especially the Pad Thai. It is very hard to mess up on Pad Thai but somehow, they did. 

To add more insult to our dinner, as my boyfriend and I were halfway eating our entrees, the inexperienced, young female server I mentioned above suddenly dropped off a check and SOMEONE ELSE'S credit card while we were clearly still not done with our food. She didn't bother to ask us questions- just a drop of the credit card and walked away. I didn't even have a chance to tell her about her mistake. I had to turn over to another table nearby and asked them if it was their credit card. Let's just say that the people at that table were not thrilled that their credit card was randomly left with strangers. 

So, the moral of this review for Krua Thai is that if you want to experience bland Thai food and terrible customer service, come here. Otherwise, AVOID.
author: Khanh T.

description: Really good Thai food. Cute portions. Spicy soup served before meal. The crab Rangoon's are amazing, as well as the red hot meal choice. The spice level wasn't what I was used to, as two stars wasn't spicy, but it might just be my tastebuds. Highly recommend.
author: Gabrielle R.

description:
Avoid the noodles.
I had one good and one very bad experience with Krua Thai, both times via Eat24.
First the good: I ordered and liked their yellow curry, and would order it again if not for my other experience.
The bad: I ordered "Pad C U" and drunken noodles via Eat24 delivery. The noodles for both dishes were of the wrong type (skinny pad thai noodles, not the flat noodles advertised) and were in a congealed mass. They weren't tasty. I asked Krua Thai to re-make, and they refused. They also refused to refund those items.
author: Eric C.

description:
Very good food, and their prices are surprisingly low!
We got the Pad Thai chicken and chicken curry lunch special. The soup with the lunch meal was really tasty. The curry was decent, but the pad thai was very good - and it was layered in such a way that it remained hot while we ate our meal.
We also got the coconut juice and it was super delicious. 
I will def come here again!
author: Arjan N.

description: Great food, healthy options, and a cute, clean, modern ambience. And moderately priced!
author: Katie N.

description:
Huge portion of foods.
My friend and I had been there twice and they never let us down.
Food is well seasoned and not too greasy.
Looking forward to be back again.
author: Alan T.

description:
Home of The Best Duck Fried Rice in the city!!!

When my favorite Thai restaurant in the neighborhood closed a year ago, I felt bereft, wondering from where I'd be able to get my future Thai food fix.  I've tried several others, but they've been hit or miss, executing one dish perfectly while leaving another devoid of flavor.  

Until the other night, when I tried Krua Thai for the first time!!!  I've walked past this restaurant a thousand times, always noting the modern, trendy decor that feels more like an upscale hotel lounge than a hipster-laden Mission restaurant...which is maybe why it's almost empty every time I pass by.  Upon first glance, I assumed it would be an overpriced clip-joint like Osha Thai, but the prices were a little more mild, and so I put it in the back of my head as a place to try some time.

I never actually made it in.  Instead, I ordered take-out when a friend was in town who wanted to hang out at my apartment.  Among those of us at dinner, we ordered a smattering of options to share:  

The Curry Samosas were delicious and not too spicy, perfect for someone like me who prefers her food mild.  It's a nice way to start dinner for someone who DOES like spice, but doesn't want to blow out their taste buds with a ton of heat on just the appetizer.

The Spicy Basil Fried Rice had excellent flavor, although it was too hot for my palate...but made everyone else in the room very happy!!

The Chicken Pad Thai was flavorful and delicious...not the usual flat noddles I'm used to, but the thinner, square-shaped type.  I prefer the former, but everything else about the dish was delish!

The Chicken Yellow Curry was so nicely flavored without being too spicy!  They seemed to use white meat, if this matters to you.

But the clear star of the night was the "KRUA" Fried Rice with Roasted Duck...Mmmmm!!!!!  Fried rice can often be really bland and too oily, but this was neither!  There were large pieces of duck, lots of egg, and just enough tomato, cucumber, and onion...So good!!  

The next time I have a yearning for Thai food, this will be my first call...and who knows, maybe next time I'll actually eat-in at the restaurant, since it looks so nice inside!
author: Amy L.

description:
Really nice surprise!
We were a large group and we had a lovely time!
The starters and the main courses were all really delicious and tasty!
The staff took good care of us, and gave us some good recommendations.
author: Geraldine F.

description:
Had a really nice dinner here with a group of friends. It's a tiny little place that has some charm. As for the dishes, I was happy with it. 

Highlights include:
Pumpkin curry (spicy!)
Pad Thai - well done classic
Crab fried rice 
Drunken noodles

Sangria (yes strange at a Thai restaurant) was delicious though! Not super strong but not overly sweet. A good and non traditional compliment to our dinner haha. 

Solid choice for Thai food. Not the cheapest Thai food I've ever had but good value for quality.
author: Grace A.

description: The BEST Thai food in the Mission, let alone SF. Family run and authentic Thai! I love this place and have been coming here for years. Everything is good, you can't go wrong.
author: Cambria S.

description:
Crispy pad Thai. Ever since the first time I ate it here, it's memory has lingered. There are so many good dishes on the menu, we've never had a clunker. 
Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Ordered tom kha, green curry, and drunken noodles.
Green curry was passable, drunken noodles were pretty flavorless and uninteresting. But the tom kha was an affront to Thai cuisine. Totally cheaping out on the mushrooms - there were literally two slices of crimini mushrooms - not straw mushrooms, which is the best part. On top of that, it was flavorless. No citrus notes, none of that bizarrely comforting flavor of galangal, just a salty-sweet mess of coconut milk and broth.

The dishes I had smack of a place that isn't even trying.
author: Sam A.

description:
I ordered the chicken skewers which were a bit smaller than usual, but was slathered in a very flavorful delicious sauce. It tasted great even without the peanut sauce, but I always love me some peanut sauce. 

The pad see ew was a bit too sweet, but overall good flavor. The eggs were a bit disappointing because they weren't cooked very well but the tofu was cooked just the way I liked it. Nice crunch and color, and just the right bite size.
author: Edmund L.

description: It was comfort thai food. A bit greasy and salty. I had the crab fried rice with brown rice and the rice was a bit soggy and overly salty and peppery. The Tom yum soup was decent. It was perfect home delivery for a sickie stuck at home. The price was cheaper than the other place which was probably the only reason why I picked it instead of all the other places. Delievery was fast too.
author: Xiu L.

description: Quick stop in the mission and this restaurant was a total treat! Great lunch special. I will totally return!!
author: Caroline S.

description: Krua Thai is one of my go to Thai spots in the city. Really reliable food. The green curry is FANTASTIC-- one of the best curries i've had (although each time you get it the flavor varies a bit.) The one bad experience-- we ordered take out and when we got home, had received the wrong order. My bf and I went back to swap out our orders, but the right one was far from being ready. So we sat down, were given free beers (!!) and had a really great date night. The staff's willingness to turn an unfortunate event into excellent customer service was super appreciated.
author: Becca C.

description: I just want to reiterate my positive review for Krua Thai. I go here frequently for take out and the service is always fast and very friendly. They know me by name (because I order way too often), and have walked my items out to me while standing on the street. Today they provided free rice when I did not order it with my meal. Delicious food and very friendly staff.
author: Gabe S.

description:
A howl in the din that is 16th Street eateries.
I found this place at about four years ago during a girl's night out and have taken at least a dozen people since. None were disappointed. The food is fresh and colorful, the service is great and during the week they have a great deal - buy one drink get the second half off..that includes wine bottles. Their appetizers, especially the wings, taffies (pastries filled with cream cheese) are great. Went last night. Admit the beef satay was a little dry but the peanut sauce was warm and creamy. The pumpkin curry was hearty and creamy and eggplant was not overcooked and tasty. My favorite thing to do along16th Street; Martini at Blondies (one will do), Thai at Krua and an ice cream cookie sandwich at Cream down the street...
author: Maria C.

description: The green curry was amazing! The Thai iced tea was perfectly sweet. Definitely coming back.
author: An D.

description: Not a fan of the restaurant after my experience of ordering a broccoli dinner with tofu and receiving 3 pieces of broccoli in my dish. Please explain that to me. The manager didn't see an issue with that, as he told me that since it's vegetarian there's more of other kinds of veggies in the dish. The ONLY reason I ordered that dish was b/c of the broccoli. It makes no sense. Don't call a dish by one vegetable's name if you don't supply more of that vegetable than any other vegetable in the dish. A) Don't order that dish if you actually want broccoli and B) Avoid that restaurant if you want to get what you think you ordered!
author: Lisi G.

description: Meh...it wasn't anything amazing. I ordered the variety appetizer, which looked promising. But it lacked flavor. The green curry rice was rather dry. The chicken for sure was dried out...it wasn't something I'd order again. It was spicy which I loved so that's why they get 3 stars.
author: Elvi F.

description: Wife and I go here all the time. Wonderful vibe and usually can find an open table. Their pad thai is great!
author: Wade W.

description:
SAWADEEKAP!

Disclaimer: my review is biased because I actually live right up stairs. My attraction to this place is due to a combination of the good food and my personal laziness. I've actually been tempted to tie a bucket to a rope to bring food up. That has not happened - yet. 

Krua Thai is my goto neighborhood Thai restaurant. As a modern-upgrade from the old Bangkok 16, Krua Thai offers decent Thai staples at reasonable prices. Definitely order crispy basil chicken, sangria, pad see ew, spicy zesty beef, and padthai. AVOID the crispy pad thai as it tastes like sweet crispy chowfun.

Enjoy the meal and the big windows for people watching!
author: John L.

description: This place is delicious! Super fresh ingredients, excellent service, quick and easy. I had the cashew nuts platter with chicken and it was delicious! My boyfriend got the sweet green, medium spicy. Good portion sizes for one if you are really hungry. The place is super clean and well decorated. Highly recommend!
author: Danielle D.

description: Nice people. Good service. Food tasty!  Fast!  Tom yum soup yummy. My parents love their food.
author: Tony S.

description: Yum, my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. Especially for delivery.
author: Jerry K.

description: A very simple Thai restaurant with a straight forward selection and clean taste. The ambiance is very casual. I like it as a great tasting restaurant at a solid price with no frills. Perfect for a chill dinner with friends or just a quick meal by yourself.
author: Li J.

description: Nice staff. Nice atmosphere. Clean. ...but the Tom Yum had the most bland broth I've ever had for this type of soup.
author: Kevin F.

description: I live in the neighborhood and get Krua at least three times a month. It's our go-to weeknight spot. So good.
author: Matt B.

description: Grabbed a few drinks before heading to abv! Papaya salad was good with happy hours on a random Monday.  Will need to check it out and give it a more accurate review in the future.  As of now, I'm a fan.
author: Patrick C.

description: Best lunch special ever! PrikKing, Himmapan, lemongrass, curries. Choose egg rolls or samosas. Comes with veggie soup! Seats are hella comfortable and the staff is Thai. Ler Ros is more flashy but Krua is more laid back. Ask for extra spicy then add more peppers!
author: Chris L.

description: This place is gross. I've tasted better Thai out of a box honestly. And the spring rolls tasted microwaved/store bought
author: Jay D.

description: Ordered through Caviar last night. Really great food, wonderful flavors, not oily at all, and you could tell the ingredients were fresh. We had the best shrimp pad thai we've ever had in SF and the massaman curry was also pretty stellar. Extremely reasonably priced and overall this place has a better quality:price point ratio than the thai place nearest our house.  We would definitely order again and will likely go to the restaurant when we're next in the area. Highly recommend!
author: Nina N.

description: Their lunch special here is pretty good. For 11 bucks it comes with soup, rice, main entrée, side dish and salad. Good deal and quite good, flavor-wise. I would come here again to try out their other stuff. I ordered the red curry for my main option for lunch and it was very tasty.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Went for dinner @ 7:30, summer night so still pretty light out. Not many people inside but was pleasantly surprised by the modern trendy vibe in a Thai restaurant. Really cute. It's a wine and beer only establishment but don't let that stop you! I had the pink mojito and LOVED it. It was great for a warm summer night. Waitress was very sweet and prompt, like the drink.
Started with prawn summer rolls and samosas. Really enjoyed both. I could really taste the mint in the rolls which was nice.
Dinner was Panang curry, my stand by favorite Thai dish for the last 12 years. It did not disappoint! I had it with tofu and veggies and it was loaded with veggies, so awesome! Also, pad Thai. More tamarind than I'm used to and less green onion than I see at other places still good though. 
All in all, it was memorable and I'd probably return.
author: Michelle G.

description: If anything, you have to order the mango sticky rice. It may take a while to come out, but hands down the best Thai dessert offered in most Thai restaurants in San Francisco!
author: Marla M.

description:
Such good takeout! Love love. 

My favorite dishes: 

- Yellow curry with chicken - not your average boring yellow curry
- Crispy chicken with basil - like chicken katsu with an amazing basil sauce
- Zesty beef - just order, trust me
- Pad see ew with beef - yummy noodles, always amazing

Local tip:

2 for 1 beer and wine on Mondays and Tuesdays or half off wine bottles (yas!)

The service is always good and everything is always amazingly clean.

Go to spot for thai food, 100%!
author: Juliet S.

description:
Simply put it, it is a ripoff. The food is not that good, the soup for example seemed to have been made from a powder.
It is a shame because it used to be OK.
author: Kazu I.

description:
I've eaten here at least a few dozen times, and the food is always consistent, fresh, and delicious - both in-restaurant and delivery/carryout (they even leave the takeout boxes cracked open so that your spring rolls and cream cheese taffies are still crispy when they get to your house). 

The ambiance inside the restaurant is a mixed bag sometimes - it's a lovely dining area and I've never had any issues with service or cleanliness, but sometimes you're the only one in the restaurant. If that's your kind of place, do it. If that's not your kind of place, it may be changing - the last few times I've walked by it looked pretty busy. Or you can stick with carryout:)
author: Emma D.

description: Met friends here for dinner one night. It's a very chic modern restaurant, I very much enjoyed the dishes we shared and the wait staff they were very helpful when it came to ordering dishes and super gracious
author: Dominick R.

description: I have had the pumpkin curry and a couple of other dishes. The food is okay, but it needs more flavor.
author: Robin O.

description:
Cute remodel, nice staff, decent food. 

We were just waking around The Mission and needed to grab dinner. This place was in front of us and we were starving! Wasn't busy at all we were the only ones there for awhile. 

Food is good, cheap prices, you get what you pay for. 

We ordered the crab rangoons (I don't recommend them, not the best I've had but suited my craving), Tom yum tofu/veggie soup (good flavoring), and tofu pad Thai (good for a pad Thai & fresh side veggies). 

Good if you need quick food, but not the best in the city.
author: Diem N.

description: Nice decor.  Delicious food is well presented and reasonably priced.  A gem of a place!
author: Natalie F.

description:
This incident was from a few months back.

Ordered a Crab Fried Rice and bit into a ton of shells. Health hazard. Never again.
author: Richard K.

description:
Love Love Love
Thai coffee, Black pepper and Garlic shrimp, Krua sampler appetizer. The Cabernet wine! Only a few blocks walk from 16th St bart location. Very easy to find. Tried it 2 weeks ago and been dreaming about it ever since!!
author: Cassondra B.

description:
The food here is so fresh and tasty! We loved the lunch special of $10 for a small appetizer, green salad, house soup, and entree.

I tried the massaman curry and mild yellow curry. Both were delicious. The soup was creamy with onions, tofu, and cilantro, and was light but also delicious. The dressing on the salad was very tasty. Will definitely be visiting again if we're in the area!
author: Kati P.

description:
Sadly this was a real disappointment - I ordered take out and the timeliness of my order was perfect. 

The delivery person - awesome. 

The food - bland, mushy and unfortunate.
author: Kelli S.

description: Damn good. Had the scallops with the roasted Chilli sauce. Stoked for the first visit.
author: Bill H.

description: Cheap produce, we order pad Thai and it taste like pasta. When we ask more spice the waiter looked at us mad and said we cannot made the food from scratch, we asked just extra spice and he got more mad. Wouldn't recommend it. I had much better Thai good...
author: A A.

description:
It is the best PERFECTO I SAY PERFECTO
The service is amazing and the food is the best. The bathrooms are very clean and tranquil, and they smell good. Also the candies at the end of the meal are delish.
author: Justin Z.

description:
This place was pretty good. Service is great. Food is good. Not great,but good enough for a 4 star rating :) 

We ordered duck and pad thai. The pad Thai needed more veggies and meat. Felt like too many noodles.
author: Cornelius V.

description: Inexpensive and yummy! I don't know how this place isn't packed all the time. Fabulous lunch spot!
author: Monica S.

description:
With so many knock-offs in the city, Osha Thai should just rip off the old Dr. Pepper jingle for their own marketing purposes..."I'm an Osha! You're an Osha! Wouldn't you like to be an Osha, too? Be an Osha. Eat at an Osha!" Because not only are there numerous Osha Thais in operation downtown but a lot of Osha Thai wannabes that try hard for the same cosmopolitan Bangkok-meets-West Elm effect (photo: http://bit.ly/TRXLjx). And you can add one more to the list, this trendy spot on 16th right off Guerrero offering a middling execution of the standard dishes. Jamie W. and I tried it when we noticed that Ramen Izakaya Goku was full up one evening.

It was quiet in there, no more than two other tables were occupied in a rather large space for the Mission. The menu listed several options including a Mix and Match section where you make your choice of meat (or non-meat) and decide what kind of preparation you want and with what side dish. Rice comes with it no matter what you order. I went to town and ordered the premium-priced $14 Duck prepared as a Cashew Nuts Platter with onions, mushrooms and carrots in that mystery "brown sauce" that apparently infiltrates the entire Asian continent (photo: http://bit.ly/1ueV9qS). It would have been fine if they didn't forget my nuts. No, I didn't forget my nuts. THEY forgot my nuts...for a change.

Jamie decided to mitigate the risk by ordering his stand-by, the $9 Drunken Noodles with Chicken (photo: http://bit.ly/1v9u7nd). Even though the execution was predictable, he at least knew what he was getting. And he got his chicken. As a shared side, we tried the $7.50 Cream Cheese Taffies, a dessert that lost its way to the menu and became an appetizer. They were deep-fried won tons stuffed with cream cheese with a bit of crab meat and onion accompanied by a sweet and sour dipping sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1sbkRkz). They were odd confections that could have been more savory to sync up with the rest of the meal. Anyway, kudos to the cleanest restroom in all of the Mission. Jamie and I were both impressed with the spa-like ambiance in there.

FOOD - 3 stars...cream cheese and no nuts
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...cheers for the restroom...otherwise, wouldn't you like to be an Osha, too?
SERVICE - 3 stars...they are a bit off here
TOTAL - 3 stars...another Osha wannabe
author: Ed U.

description: Fabulous lunch spot. Stir fried eggplant is to die for!
author: Vibha B.

description:
Awful service. Had to flag down the waiters each time for service. Food was your run of the mill thai food, wouldn't recommend it.

In fairness I may have ordered the wrong thing (crab fried rice) which I did not enjoy. Everyone else on my party loved their food however, so I bumped this from a 2 star to 3 star.
author: Michael F.

description: Great food! The $10 lunch special is great deal an the appetizers were delicious!! Especially the cream cheese taffies.  Service was amazing!
author: Sarah R.

description:
I'm a Thai food snob. Big time. My SD, LA, and SF friends come to me when asking where to go, and what to order. Simple as that.

This has been my favorite Thai place in the Bay Area thus far. Even better than Lers Ros, in my opinion, which is upheld by many a foodie as the preeminent Thai food location in Northern California. I think the Krua Thai bests it.

I had the tom kha gai soup, followed by the pad see ew with beef. Both were excellent. Flavors, temperatures, spice-level, all spot-on. I tried a few of my friends' dishes and every one of them was simply a bullseye.

It has a nice aesthetic, it's located close to my apartment in the city, the prices are reasonable, the staff are friendly, and every dish was just perfection.

Word of warning to my white bretheren: When you say "spicy", you better damn well mean it. They don't adapt to a midwestern sensibility. You remember that line in Tombstone... "You called down the thunder? Well, NOW. YOU. GOT IT!" It's a lot like that.
author: Sean B.

description:
I placed an order through EAT24 and the delivery was pretty quick.  I ordered crab meat fried rice, summer rolls, chicken wing and roti!!!!

I decided to try this place out due to the reviews and pictures. The wings are the BOMB.COM, they are different from any other Thai restaurants that I tried, it's super good and yummy!! The crab meat fried rice was perfect and thank you for not putting carrots and peas.  The rolls were good and glad they have me extra peanut sauce. The roti was sooooo good and sooooo happy that the sweet creme sauce was not drizzed on them, but put on the side. 

I will order from this place again in the future.
author: Wena D.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the area. Really love the pineapple fried rice...haven't found one that delicious anywhere!
author: Brian E.

description: My friend and I came here for late lunch on a Wednesday afternoon. They had two for one drink specials. My friend had their Riesling and at first, she was not very happy because it was sour. It hadn't gone bad but it wasn't what you'd expect from a Riesling so we asked to see the bottle. Sure enough, the brand specialized in tart flavors. Then she got a champagne which she was happier with. They have a good selection of wines and beer. We ordered a large Tom Yum Soup with Seafood, Shrimp Pad Thai and Chicken Pad Kee Mao (Drunken Noodles). The soup was tasty but there was hardly anything it in, just a few pieces of seafood and some mushrooms. No tomatoes and there weren't very many mushrooms. The Pad Thai was good but the Pad Kee Mao had the perfect amount of spiciness to it. Nothing is outstanding here but it was a nice modern Thai restaurant with friendly service and good food with decent prices. I judge my Thai restaurants on their spiciness and was happy with the level I received.
author: Jen L.

description: This review is for carry-out/delivery only. They unfortunately always include egg even when I specify NO EGG for my dishes. Same with fish sauce and shrimp paste. If you have any kind of dietary limitations, I would not trust them. I've been 3 times and they've messed this up each time. Even though it's super close to my house, I will never return.
author: Jess H.

description:
This is a nice, quiet, nicely designed restaurant that serves excellent food. The service is always pleasant and I am never disappointed with the food. Great for vegetarians by the way! 

Hope it sticks around!
author: David C.

description: Great lunch special prices but the food was nothing special to write home about. Service was mediocre.
author: Holly M.

description: Got food from here twice for a group event. Somehow, I swear, the food tasted so much better the second time. Served a ton of food. Good curries! I liked their garlic veggie thing. I'd probably visit and have a sit-down if I was in the area.
author: Jen A.

description:
Less than a mile away but over an hour for delivery?
BUMMER

"Pad C U"?
2 GREASY 

Garlic and Black Pepper Sauteed with Chicken?
OVERCOOKED BLANDNESS

Summer Rolls?
JUST FINE

The search for go-to Thai delivery in SF?
CONTINUES...
author: Amy C.

description: Reasonably priced, well portioned dishes, and all somewhat surprising for a trendily decorated space. Good Thai experience in a part of town sorely in need of better options. Recommend drunken noodles and the eggplant dish. Also Krua's Thai iced teas are delicious.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Friendly service but not authentic thai. 

I ordered just the regular Green Curry and Pad Thai, and the noodles were too sticky and on the harder side. Green Curry was very basic and not thick and creamy more watery. It was not terrible but significantly not the best I've had. 
We did order the spring rolls and they were tasty.

If you love your thai food go somewhere else, if you're hungry and don't really care this will feed you! 

Plus 2 for 1 beer and wine M-F
author: Dede C.

description:
If you love Thai food, come here! I have lived in San Francisco my entire life and there are only a handful of good Thai restaurants - this is in my top 3! I randomly stumbled upon this place via open table and am so happy that I did! 

The first time I came here, my mom and I ordered their papaya salad, drunken noodles and a veggie sriracha dish. Every single bite that we had, we loved. Everything was full of amazing AND authentic flavor. All of the ingredients were very fresh and I loved how the vegetables weren't overcooked - there was still a slight crunch in every bite. I highly recommend ordering those items, especially the papaya salad - the best papaya salad I have tasted in SF (and that's a bold statement)! 

The second time I came here was with my best friend for lunch. We both checked in on yelp and our meal was $7, instead of $10. Their lunch special is incredible - it comes with soup, an appetizer and a main dish. We had their tom yum (SO good, I wanted to order a whole bowl), grab and cheese wonton (I forget the actual name that this place calls it) and their green / pumpkin curry. I had the green curry with tofu/veggies and loved every bite of it. I recommend ordering their brown rice (extra $1). 

Service is excellent. Jack has been our waiter the past two times and he is so nice and knowledgeable. Always has a smile on his face and makes the dining experience at this place that much better! Whenever I would ask for a recommendation, he was always honest. I'm the type of person that always needs a lot of things (i.e. spicy sauces, extra napkins, etc.) and Jack was very accommodating.  

I can't wait to be back and try other items on the menu!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Nice Thai place in the heart of the "cool" part of the Mission. For a more authentic "old-style neighborhood, try a stroll down the 18th St. corridor starting at Mission and going south ... if you have time, hang a right on Balmy St. (alley) and check out the cool murals.

Scoutmob app offers a half-off deal here if you'd like to save some cabbage.
author: John H.

description:
Extremely solid drunken noodles. So solid, in fact, that I have never ordered anything else. I sometimes peruse the rest of the menu to see if something can tempt me past the high level of enjoyment I get from the drunken noodles, but it never happens. I also appreciate that they call them drunken noodles instead of pad kee mao.

For some reason this place is usually empty tho. No idea why, they are definitely far above average in the San Francisco Thai category. It is also in a happening location, with tons of bars and lounges to check out after dinner. In this case, others' loss is your gain! There is never a wait and the service is prompt. I can usually do a sit down dinner here in 30 minutes for only $15 (can never resist the Thai iced tea).

Additionally, their restroom is quite clean.
author: Michael S.

description: First time at the restaurant and we found it absolutely fantastic.  We had the pad Thai and a curry dish. Our waiter Mischa was very informative and extremely friendly we will definitely be back
author: Todd S.

description: Waitress so nice and super cute.. Also lunch special u get more than u paid! This is my first time here.. Will be back to get some happy hour on Tuesday beer and wine get 2 pay only 1 !
author: Nichapatr P.

description: Ordered from Krua the other night based off the recommendation of a friend. She mentioned that when you get pad Thai delivered, it doesn't arrive all dry like other places. And she was right!!!!! I ordered the pad Thai with tofu and veggies through Postmates. Although it took over an hour to arrive, it was warm and definitely far from dry! The serving size is also huge here. You will have enough for 2+ meals. I think I found my new go to for Thai delivery!
author: Gina P.

description: I just wanted to formally review the service from this restaurants employee. The delivery guy did not follow delivery instructions. The food arrived over an hour later, basically just warm. When I came downstairs he was rude and started arguing with me. On top of all of this he could barely give me change back without my assistance. Worst delivery experience ever. I would highly suggest ordering from somewhere else.
author: matt t.

description: The food, ambiance, service, location, and menu are on point. Love this place. Brought my moms here for mothers day and she had that two for one wine. It was a cool night. Definitely recommend checking it.
author: Danny B.

description:
HMMM... THAI FOOD!!!
(3.85 stars)

Krua = Kitchen (google it!)

One look at this place and my friends will say "THAT'S SUCH A PLACE YOU'D EAT AT." Yah-darn-skippy about that. However, nothing caught my eye on the menu until I read Krua CRISPY PAPAYA salad and CRISPY PAD THAI. Love places when they can get creative yet keep a dish in its naturalness. Since then I've had my eye to come here and then BAM there was a deal. You've been Scoutmob'ed and scored 50% off. 

*pictures are posted*

- Food, yummy. very similar to osha but i think i like kura better
- Prices, affordable (lunch)
- Service, on-point. very into catering their customers. 
- Ambiance, simple chic and modernized

FOOOOOD adventure!!!! Walking around the city on a beautiful Saturday on one of my solo journeys, decided to get up on my deals and make the best of it. The best time to use a deal is during lunch and decided to come here right when they open, 11:30AM to get my grub on. Not alot of people where there, unlike evenings. Small space but plenty of tables to sit at. Lovely decor and very clean. Seated by the window and was served like a queen.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

KRUA CRISPY PAPAYA SALAD w/ PRAWNS ($8) - Crispy papaya topped with garlic, thai chili, tomatos, and peanuts in lime dressing. I love papaya salad but never had a crispy papaya salad. And i'm picky because some salads can have an overpowering dressing, but at Krua, they made it very good. CRISPY!!! that's a first. They deep fry the shreds of papaya but everything else is like a normal papaya sald. It came with 3 large prawns. The only annoying thing about eating the papaya salad was that each strand stuck to each other so when getting a bite, it was the entire thing and I had to use my fingers to pry a portion off and onto my fork. Besides that, it was yummy. The portion can be shared with another but since it was just me, it was large. Enough to pack 3/4 of it to take home.

GINGER AND SCALLIONS w/ chicken and 2 taffies ($10) - W-O-R-T-H-Y!!!! soup, salad, appetizer, and main dish with rice.This is an item on the lunch menu. served with house soup, side salad, choice of 2 cripsy egg rolls or samosa or taffies, or shumai, and rice. Also choice of chicken, beef, pork or tofu & vegetables. Like usually, i went with chicken. You ask what are taffies? GET THEM. Taffies are like crab ragoon, they are crispy wontons filled with cream cheese, crab meat, and green onion, servered with sweet and sour sauce. My main dish was typical tasting, tasted like any other thai restaurant. But it was very fresh and delicious - maybe because I was there right when they opened and everything was just made fresh.

SANGRIA ($6) - very delicious sangria. lots of fruits and the merlot was infused well, tasted like JUICE. Didn't have dessert, no room, but this was basically my dessert. 

My bill came out to $24 dollars even but with the 50% discount, it came up to $12/$13 after tax. Absolutely, I scored on this food adventure.

Will I be back? YES. I'd love to come back and try the crispy pad thai.

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description: Love the modern trendy look because once you sit inside it feels cozy and friendly still. It is our favorite Thai place and we drive from the other side of town just for that perfect taste. Pineapple curry fried rice was delicious and they always have sangria and good wines
author: Rei L.

description:
Ordered this on Postmates aka payed way too much for the delivery fee etc. 
Truly the worst tom yum ive tasted and I grew up here.....it tasted like someone took half tom yum half water and mixed it together. The crab rangoon were pretty tiny, but at least good. 
The chicken pad thai could have had more sauce. No chili sauce was included which was pretty lame.
author: Christina P.

description: I've been here maybe 4-5 times and find the food to be consistently very good. the vegetables are always fresh and crunchy, which is important to me. Friendly service, too.
author: Tom F.

description: Drive by this place all the time and finally tried it. It is way better, more flavorful & cheaper then Lers Ros. We had yellow curry, pad c u, zesty beef. All delish, we were super happy. And we've had the hardest time finding a great Thai place, not just ok. This is our new go to.
author: Alma H.

description:
I got back from Thailand not too long ago and was looking for something to satisfy my Thai cravings, and decided to give this place a try (instead of my normal Thai spot Lers Ros). The food was pretty good with good authentic flavors. I wanted Laab,Tom Yum soup with chicken, and some basil pork, which while not on the menu, the manager was more than happy to make it happen. 

My complaint about the place is that the service staff is still kinda new and don't have much knowledge about thai dishes and what they should look like. They brought out some sticky rice that was either dessert sticky rice or half cooked. Wasn't quite sure.. On the plus side, as soon as I mentioned something, it was fixed pretty fast with no questions.

I think this place has great potential and I will be back soon. Will update review when I have more..
author: James S.

description: I came here on mothers day with my mom and family. We had a reservation. It took a very long time to get serviced. The lady that took our order was ok. We waited for our food to be served and the asian man serving was very rude. He literally just threw the plates of food on the table did not tell us what was what and when we asked a question he acted incredibly irritated. My mom ordered shrimp and chicken pad thai and she was served some sort of crispy noodle that was gross. When I told the lady at the front that she made it seem like my mom made a mistake and not her. She tried to argue with my mom. All she had to do was have the tried to make her food over correctly. I did catch the lady and the server talking shit about us for asking for them to correct our order not professional at all. When they finally brought the correct pad thai it was weird and slimy thin spaghetti like noodles? As for the food it was ok nothing special I have had better thai food in oakland and san rafael. The sangria here in my opinion was mediocre. 1 star for ok prices. Overall the service here sucks the waiting staff needs to get there attitudes in order. Customer service is key
author: Aminah H.

description: Pretty darn good food. In a see of madness, it's nice to have a 16th St. retreat from it all that was much less crowded than other places. They had good beer selection and good solid Chili Basil Chicken (krad gra prow?) I would like to return.
author: Seanessy G.

description: Great flavors. I prefer Krua Thai over the two other Thai restaurants nearby.
author: Sandro T.

description: Excellent thai - us Aussies have a high standard for thai and this ticks all the boxes
author: Paull Y.

description:
I was there on a Saturday at 2 and no one was there. The waiter was hot, nice and attentive. I ordered the pad c u. It was a little salty but i still ate a lot of it
 My over all experience was good, I would come again. Thanks hot waiter.
author: David E.

description: Awesome food in a nice ethnic neighborhood. Actually went there two times in a row because the food was so good. Ended up waiting a bit on the second night because someone called out sick  but it was worth it. Definitely would recommend this place if you're looking for really good Thai food in SF.
author: Chris D.

description: I had a great dinner with my boyfriend here! We really enjoyed the drunken noodles and cashew nut platter. Large servings for a good price! It wasn't busy when we came so we were served fairly quickly. The restaurant also nice a nice, modern ambience.
author: Jenny N.

description:
This place serves up delicious thai food that doesn't break the bank.

Decent wine selection but its the food that is the winner here.

My fav's are the krua fried rice and pad thai, yum!

And if your in a rush you can pre order your dish on food24
author: Rogelio V.

description: Bland and bland with a side of bland.  At least they have lunch specials where you can get a discount on bland.
author: Kamael S.

description: Went to a Javascript Meetup event and they had food from this restaurant. I had pad see ew, chicken, beef, crispy chicken, etc. It was nice to have Thai food at a techie event.
author: Denise C.

description:
Seriously? This place has nice decor and all but I can't say the same about the food.

My experience here was disappointing. The chicken in my curry was extremely dry..
The prices are relatively high for poor thai food... and to top things off... The waiters were extremely rude! 

Sorry, not sorry.
author: Leilani Y.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. I really did, but I have to admit, it wasn't my favorite.

I was happily greeted by soup...however it was far too flavorful for my taste.

Next, I had the spring rolls. The spring rolls are fresh and I had the chance to add prawns or tofu. I can't say I felt like the prawns really went well with the rolls, but the bargain hunter in me felt like it was a better deal than tofu. Also...I don't like tofu. There was also only enough peanut sauce for two half rolls. 

And last, I had the Rad Na, which is my favorite Thai dish of all time. There was so much pepper in it, much like that of my soup. They only had like 6 pieces of beef in it, and they put in this Asian vegetable (I call it Chinese broccoli), which totally doesn't go with the dish. I'm unimpressed.

I came after a 2 mile walk/jog at 3pm, so most things would've blown me away for lunch since I was starving. 

The service was fantastic, and the place looks clean and chic, but I've had way better food from a food cart. And at half the price. Portland has made me a Thai food snob.

Not sure I would recommend this place, but if you go, just avoid what I ordered.
author: Ophelia Y.

description: The food here is pretty good,and reasonably cheap.The portions on some items are a little small when you go for take out(like soup unless you get like a big noodle type soup).Nice people working there
author: Lauren V.

description: This place is delicious. I've had the fried rice and noodles and all are very good. They never disappoint and the restaurant is very clean with a great looking modern design.
author: Tony D.

description: Crispy papaya salad?  Why not just call it "fried"?  Or better yet, "greasy"?  'Cause that's what it is!  Gross.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Tepid, mild Thai food.

I came here for dinner last Friday with one of my friends. It was rainy and cold outside, and I was looking forward to warming up with some amazing Thai food. 

Our server was very attentive; maybe even too attentive. There weren't very many customers in the restaurant when we were there, so he came to take our orders within two minutes of our arrival. We weren't ready, so we asked him to come back later. Until we looked over and signaled to him ten minutes later, he was waiting patiently behind us just staring at us. Perhaps he could have gone into the kitchen for a while instead of standing there looking at us.

To eat, I had the Hot Red Curry with chicken. The food was brought out to us really quickly. What was surprising was that the food was not hot (in temperature or in spice). How could the food be lukewarm? It's not like it was sitting sitting out for thirty minutes or something. If they are cooking the food fresh, it just does not seem possible that the food could cool down to that temperature in such a short amount of time. It's really suspicious. 

While the curry was neither hot nor spicy, it did have a nice flavor profile. The curry comes with a good variety of fresh vegetables (peas, carrots, bamboo shoots, mushrooms, bell peppers, and basil leaves) too. 

I don't think I would come here again for dinner. Maybe if I lived in the area, I might order to-go and heat up the curry at home over the stove and add some spices.
author: Ravi S.

description:
I'm really surprised this place doesn't have better reviews. They have delicious food, a nice ambience in a trendy location, great service, and moreover you usually don't have to wait in the line to go there. I usually get the drunken noodles, which are delicious and just a little bit spicy at their baseline level. However, I've tried a number of the curries which are also delicious. Every time I've been, the food is really good.

Plus, everyone at the restaurant is really nice and it's a laid-back place. Have a drink or some sangria, chill by the window, and watch people walk down 16th St. while you get some delicious Thai food. What's not to like?
author: Brent W.

description:
I dropped by here with Amy J on a Mission lunch stop.

After checking out the menu I ended up choosing the make your own soup dish with thin noodles. The food was quite tasty but I had to remind them to put no tofu in the soup and sadly it didn't come out with the protein in it I expected.

We'd stopped in because Amy had a scoutmob coupon, which they took with a little too much fanfare but were friendly and quick the entire time we were there.

The only real negative in my book is that bathroom which was extremely dark and smelled a little strange. Always a scary thing at a restaurant. 

All in all though I'd come back for another try.
author: Meg T.

description:
The good?  I ordered through Door Dash and the delivery was nice and quick.  The "pad c u" was pretty good - a little on the greasy side but not the worst. 

The bad?  Around 30 minutes after eating the pad c u, I started throwing up.  It was pretty clear that I had gotten food poisoning from the pad c u because I hadn't eaten anything else all day.  After a couple hours spent curled around the toilet throwing up everything I had just eaten, I can guarantee I'll never order from here again.
author: Hannah K.

description: Not sure why this place doesn't have a better review. Great ambiance and friendly staff. Dishes worth trying include green papaya salad, spicy string beans, salt and pepper chicken, and chicken pad Thai.
author: Andrew W.

description: Tom Yum Souppppppp and their red curry was pretty bomb dot com
author: Brittney B.

description:
A modern mime has decorated his abode. The lines, the edges, and margins unite in blade-like fashion. Soft grays, bold blacks, and opaque whites govern the walls. 

The porcelain: square, rectangular. No time for circles. Can I have this plate? The art-of-the-slate.

Bay windows for a spectator show. 

Sangria and Thai Iced Tea. A spectrum of unknown.

Cashew Nuts Platter Sauteed with Chicken, Crispy Chicken with Basil, Krua's Zesty Beef, Mango with Sweet Sticky Rice. 

The food is tantalizing. Sweet sauces seep between the meats, but this comes with bias while on keto. Cashew Nuts Platter takes the show this time. 

The Mango with Sweet Sticky Rice, perfect. 

Ask for Jack.
author: Alejandro A.

description:
Outstanding food. Great service. I've been here twice. The curries are really tasty and recently I tried the zesty beef. 

The meat was well cooked and the sauce was on point. Could have been a little spicier but that's a small downside. 

Main courses go from 11 to 13 dollars.
author: Peter H.

description: Your basic Thai restaurant. I think most of the Thai restaurants serve exactly the same things. There are a few super good ones but the rest are all the same. Basil eggplant, pumpkin curry, etc etc. Same old same old.
author: Amy M.

description:
I had a Scoutmob coupon and a date with Meg T so we wandered over here for some tasty bites and much needed catch up. Yes, I actually have to schedule time with this lovely lady. 

I ordered the drunken noodles which I amazingly finished. I guess I was hungrier than I thought because I normally take half of it with me. Meg ordered a soup of some sort minus the soy. They were very helpful and service was great.

Prices were pretty reasonable. Thanks to Scoutmob, I found a new place to eat in the Mission as if I need another reason to go back.
author: Amy J.

description:
I came here for the lunch special which consists of a choice of appetizer, house salad, soup, and a smaller entree for just $10. That's a lot of food for a small amount of money! I got the egg rolls, salad, soup, and the hot red curry. The curry came out with the right amount of creamy and sweet- super delicious. My boyfriend got the Thai ice tea, and from that one sip I had, it tastes pretty good. The only complaint I had would be that I didn't get to finish my food because I got full too quickly!

I'm going to go back, for sure.
author: Saewah K.

description:
The manager here has the customer service skills of a cat: self absorbed, aloof, and claws ready.  Or like the Seinfeld soup nazi, without the good food.

Girlfriend and I ordered food to go, took it home 20 min away, and discovered it was not good despite positive yelp reviews.  It's like going to see that movie you've been wanting to see and being disappointed when you actually see it. 

So we called back and said we weren't happy.  The man on phone asked us to bring the food back.  But we were already home so we asked for a credit.  Up to this point, the conversation was fine.

But this is where things take a turn for the crazy.

The man on phone said we were "one of those customers," that tries to just get free food.  We were flabbergasted - who makes a presumption like that and voices it to a customer?  

We said that was rude, we are customers voicing our concern with the food.  We wanted to give the restaurant another shot.

As we said this, the man on phone started talking over us.  

So we asked for his name and to speak with his manager. The man wouldn't give us his name, and hung up on us. Seriously? 

We then decided to go back to the restaurant and complain to the manager about the man on the phone, just about principle at this point.

We get to the restaurant, see the man who answers the phone, and find he IS the manager. 

We told him again why we were dissatisfied with the food, and we didn't appreciate how he insulted us and hung up.

He didn't apologize for his food or his behavior.  He claimed he hung up because he had a lot of other calls. Pretty sure you don't ever hang up on a customer. 

He said he could refund us if we leave his restaurant.  So we said ok, we didn't like his food anyway.

He said the food is the way it is, and kept talking.  One of his employees touched him on the chest, like "stop", and he stormed off.

The employee had to step in and process the refund, and apologized the food wasn't what we expected, and apologized for the inconvenience. 

Overall the big picture is this: customers bring you money.  It's cheaper to keep a customer than acquire one.  And a pissed off customer tells way more people about their bad experience than happy customers: this one definitely is going to be a fun story to share.  So why would you insult a customer, treat them rudely, and make no effort to keep them, especially on their first trip?  Shockingly unprofessional - doesn't make sense.  

The manager should go back to being a house cat. Reow.
author: Charlie B.

description:
Stumbled (literally) upon this place, and I've been back frequently.  

Scenarios:
- In the Mission? Park and head to Krua.  
- Have a friend with Foursquare/Scoutmob.  Ask and head to Krua.  
 - Around Dolores Park? Walk over and head to Krua.

I usually do not understand the servers, but they are really helpful and the service is great!  Our servers filled up our waters a ton of times.  These people know me by name and what I order: sampler and the crispy chicken.  consistent and clean.  

I enjoy the atmosphere because it is different from a "traditional" Thai restaurant.  It feels like a lounge in the evening.  

All in all, I would recommend this place and maybe continue with drinks at Elixir next door.
author: John Michael R.

description:
I bet you your bathroom at home does not smell as nice as the one at Krua. Yes, I am reviewing a restaurant but I must say, the bathroom has a spa-esque vibe going on.

Now, onto the food.
Lots of options, most with the option of: vegetarian (all veg/tofu), seafood, chicken, beef/pork.

Menu is easy to read (categorized by dish type: curries, noodles, soups) and easy to decipher spiciness.

Recommended starters: Egg rolls and SHUMai (steamed)

YUM Ocean Salad - healthy, light, protein centric share dish. Calamari/squid not the greatest - possibly smidge overcooked.

Rarity: Most main dishes actually come with rice included! Most places seem to be charging extra these days.
Mains are sized that you can finish a whole one (so if you were thinking you'd have leftovers, order an app)

Price point makes it accessible to hit up Krua fairly regularly and not break the bank.

Nothing extraordinary here but very reliable and a great option when scouting for Thai.
author: Alissa A.

description:
This is a little popup shop that showed up on my scoutmob app so I decided to swing by.

Their papaya salad is suuuper tasty! Second best in the city I've tried.

Green curry with sticky rice was good and so was the pad thai. Nothing too special, but it was good enough that I would definitely come back whenever I have a hankering for Thai.

Oh, and the waiters are super attentive and nice too.
author: Angela L.

description: Service amazing wings perfect mess of sweet and spicy. And got seated right away on a Friday night
author: Morgan S.

description:
We came in here last week while visiting family and friends for a late Sunday dinner. I'm not one for Thai but I kept an open mind and found some good stuff on the menu to try. 

We sat for a few minutes and finally got up to grab our our menus. The guy looked a little embarrassed that he forgot to give us them. Other than that service was good (the place was almost empty).

We started with chicken skewers and the Summer Rolls with tofu. The peanut sauce with the Summer Rolls was SO good, we all liked it better than the sauce with the skewers.

I had the Drunken Noodles with tofu and veggies mild and my husband had the Massaman super spicy. I didn't really care for the tofu, it was pretty bland but the noodles and vegetables themselves were delicious! I wouldn't have minded a bit more broccoli (only two big stalks were in there) but it was a big meal and I really enjoyed it. Husband said his was delicious as well. There were some other Drunken Noodle eaters in our party (vegan style) and I don't remember what our other friend had. We all enjoyed and left happy though! All around a good experience and a nice looking spot.
author: Erin H.

description:
I love this place :) 

If you're looking for a restaurant in the Mission that is NOT crowded, this is the place to go! The environment is super chill and I just sit here for hours and chat with my friends :)

Also there's free wine on Wednesday :)
author: Brian W.

description:
On  a Tuesday night about 7pm
Seating = 5 stars. No wait
Service = 4 stars.  Everything necessary but nothing to put it over the top.
Specials = 4 stars. Mon & Tue is 2/1 beer and wine $5 beer, $6-9 Wine

Food
SHUmai Appetizer = 2 stars.  Too fishy tasting $6
KRUA's Zesty Beef = 4 stars.  Very good. $12
Chicken Pad Thai = 2 stars.  Way too salty.  Not very flavorful. $11
author: Cap P.

description:
I came here for a bday celebration or i wouldn't know this place exists.  Really modern and clean decor (read: ikea/west elm/crate & barrel).  The two doors side-by-side separated by a sliver of wall really confused me but both doors will get you in and out.  There's a full bar and they serve sangria.  I was sort of expecting a creative sangria with some thai-ness to it but nope, it was just good ol' regular sangria with lots of fruit.  It was good. :)

The menu is short and sweet instead of pages upon pages of choices, which works out for me because it eliminates my indecisiveness.  I really can't remember what I ordered but there was meat, basil, veggies, and spiciness involved.  I did ask for it to be extra spicy and wasn't impressed with the level of heat.  I dont know if my shade of yellow didn't give off the hint that i meant it when i asked for extra spicy?  Moving on...

My review is a few weeks delayed but considering that I can't remember what I ate or could recall any blow off my socks moments...Krua is just alright.
author: Sally T.

description:
I am a bit surprised to see the lack of love for Krua. I've been a number of times and to me, it's always spot-on. I was there a couple of weeks ago with a group. We ordered up a whole table of greatness, floating the platters up and down, trying to take all that we wanted, without being a punk about it. You know how that goes. Trying to share with your friends, but really wanting to stop the plates that are your favorite, and shoveling it ALL onto your own plate.

Or is that just me...?!

Service was spot-on. Prices were reasonable. Everything was hella fresh. I dig the decor. It's not traditional....but it's not the trying-hard Osha Thai either. (I had Osha too, same week....also good, but not better than Krua!).

KRUA is grand. Don't believe the haters. Go peep it yourself. For realz. Yum! Yum! Yum!  I wish I could go NOW!
author: Opinions Are My Own, G.

description:
Krua Thai was pretty weak. This new restaurant's modern, metallic decor must of cost a mint; a mod decor that suggests quality eats but the food was simply bad. 

Our Green Papaya Salad w Prawns ($8) smelt off (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/7e_4JNiYybBil61dNVHpog?select=tkHszgdc8l77-7vjaM5mLA). I've never been repelled by a dish before. My guess was it had too much fish oil. But really have no clue as to why it smelt weird. I would have excused this if it had tasted amazing. It didn't. The green papaya could of benefited from more time to ripen. The shrimp was pretty ok. 

The Summer Rolls ($7) were okay at best, but I've ordered in rolls that were better. Way too much carrot and mint really unbalanced the taste. 

The best gauge of any Thai restaurant is their Pad Thai ($11), which hit just bellow par (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/7e_4JNiYybBil61dNVHpog?select=6v1Yd5gai8Td3_JqR3z6PA). A bit under flavored and the noodles over fried. 

The sautéed Ginger & Scallions ($11) made the meal more passable but in the end nothing to write home about (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/7e_4JNiYybBil61dNVHpog?select=jCLLl8Om2E_j8AqK8H-slA).

My Singha leaned pricey but acceptable for a 12oz bottle for $5. Though $5 gets you a 22 oz at some restaurants.

The kicker is I was a tad inebriated upon arrival. Shouldn't a few drinks make cuisine better?
author: Quentin J.

description:
I went here last night for my 24th birthday! And I absolutely was amazed that they served my party of 11 people with ease! 

The waiter was super friendly and patient. And the busser never let us want for anything. It was a cute little setting for my birthday. 

The food was sooo good! I had the colored duck, and it was delicious and very flavorful. Thank you Krua Thai for making my birthday wonderful!
author: August S.

description: Yum! Cheap/danky thai food, what's not to love?! I got the classic pad thai with shrimp and my boyfriend ordered the crispy pad thai with chicken. I absolutely loved my pad thai--fresh, saucy and huge portions. He wasn't as thrilled with the crispy, sometimes risks don't pay off. If you're getting the pad here, I highly suggest the original. Don't fix something if it's not broken, yaddamean?!
author: Allison D.

description: I never write reviews, but this place is awesome for the price!  $10 lunch special w salad, soup. entree, and rice!  I am just back from Thailand, and this place has this flavors, just right, and fresh ingredients too.
author: Dan O.

description:
Went from average to below average.

The service was super slow and the food took way too long to come out. They took a while to take our order then forever to even bring water. We had picked up pastries for dessert and ended up eating those because we could no longer wait.

Our eggplant dish also came out undercooked and when we told the server, he had an attitude about it but eventually took it back. It had taken so long at this point that we told him to just cancel it, but he literally would not let us. We bit our tongues and asked him to box it then into two separate boxes so we could both take it home. He didn't, just one box and the eggplant was still undercooked when I had it the next day.

The service was just so rude that I think I'll find it hard to give them another chance.
author: Raina B.

description:
Krua Thai is consistently good! While I have never visited the restaurant, I have it on speed dial for Thai takeout. On a few separate occasions, I have ordered the green curry with chicken ($11), drunken noodles with beef ($9) and the pad see ewe ($9), as well as the crispy veggie spring rolls to start. The service is friendly and accommodating (by accommodating, I mean that I have a gripping phobia* of onions (yellow, red and white; see also: shallots, chives, leeks -- the whole family) and they were able to make all of the above without any (discernible) onion. A+! The noodle dishes are always perfectly cooked with fresh, tasty vegetables; nothing is overly heavy or oily. The green curry was tasty and flavorful (if not very spicy), and the veggie rolls are delicious. They have always arrived within the specified delivery time, too (usually 45-60 minutes).

Of note: $25 minimum for delivery; it's easily met when ordering for two if you order an appetizer. 

*I do mean phobia, rather than fear (some attempt to correct my usage of "phobia" when it comes to onions, but I assure you that it is, in fact, real).
author: Katie M.

description:
Update: one night we were super lazy and so we actually came back to Krua.  They had read our yelp review and knew who we were ahead of time since we always order the same thing.  When we entered they were very apologetic. They literally gave us a whole container full of hot sauce without us asking (wayyy to much, but we appreciate the gesture).

It's great to see buisness that listen to their customers and were happy to be coming here again regularly as we really love the food.
author: Matt S.

description:
TL;DR decent flavors, spice level is inconsistent, overpriced for what it is.

I ordered delivery scheduled for 7:30 so I'd have some time to get home, shower, and settle in. It showed up at 6:45 *just* as I was arriving at my apartment. I literally walked up behind the delivery guy at my door as he was about to call my phone. Not a good start.

I'm fighting a cold and my usual go-to is spicy thai food, so I ordered a lot, hoping to get me through the weekend. The serving sizes were a little on the smaller side, but not unreasonable. I read reviews that spicy is *spicy* here, so I used a little bit of restraint, as I haven't had much spicy food recently and I'm out of practice.

Here is a breakdown:

Tom Yum (medium): not spicy at all, hardly any vegetables or meat, and the broth was bland & way too salty
Wings ("spicy hot"): barely any spice, but overall quality and flavor were OK
Drunken noodles ("spicy hot"): gross mushy noodles, but flavor and spice were good
Cucumber Salad: meh, 'nuff said

I'm not sure if eating in makes a big difference versus delivery, but the restaurant is far enough out of my way that delivery is really the main option. On to the next one...
author: Jesse F.

description:
Just a few blocks away from BART's 16th Street station, Krua Thai is near a hub of restaurants that all offer different cuisines.

It has an interesting modern atmosphere to it and there's tons of light that comes through the open windows. The staff were friendly and attentive.

A waiter suggested we start off with the Cream Cheese Taffies, which are priced at a pretty steep price of $7.50. As promised, though, it was a unique and delicious appetizer that was perfect to start off the meal. The crispy won ton taffies are filled with rich cream cheese, crab meat, and green onions. It only comes with a small portion of five: a good thing because it's a pretty rich and heavy appetizer, but a bad thing considering the price of them. 

I then chose to get the Drunk Noodles, which is one of their signature entree items. To be quite honest, I couldn't tell the difference between their noodles and chow fun. The noodles and accompanying vegetables weren't well-cooked and it made a struggle to finish the plate. I tried my friend's Pad Thai and was disappointed by how they cooked a signature dish like that. 

We also had the Thai iced tea, which was good but a little overly sweet. We ended the night with a classic Thai dessert, sticky rice and mango. The mango was very sweet and tasty, but the sticky rice was coated in a sauce that seemed like condensed milk. It added an odd taste and texture to the rice so we ended up eating more of the mangoes than we did the rice.

Overall, the atmosphere of the restaurant is nice. If you're looking for authentic Thai food though, you should try looking somewhere else.
author: Jane H.

description: Pick one of the many other Thai options in the neighborhood. Ordered here a few times - food is decent. But tonight we ordered with an estimated delivery time of 45 minutes. Our food arrived TWO HOURS later, barely lukewarm.  No explanation when we called, and no apology when it arrived. The reverse - the driver was an complete jerk, extremely rude and... (as weird as this sounds) mean. Annoyed we had to wait 2 hours for our food... But much angrier about the way we were treated.
author: Neil M.

description: This is a pretty good Thai place. I really like their pumpkin curry.
author: Peter K.

description:
Tried dishes
Kamikaze not great. Vegs under cook
Salmon. Nothing special
Duck average
Crispy pad thai good
Sea splash.. too much bamboo favor in curry.. dont like.

2.5 star for food
3 star service. Doesn't Remember who order what.
4 star for decoration and nice bathroom.
author: Taye N.

description:
Cute little spot with amazingly great lunch specials. 

It was a Saturday. $10 got me soup, salad, 2 taffies & green chicken curry. The soup and salad are staple, but the app and entree are just a few from the list of options. 

I also ordered a pink mojito as well as a side order of taffies. Those things are addicting! 

Only 1 FOH worker, and about 5 other diners. Don't know why not many people were there. 

Music was hip 90's punk band music, stuff you'd hear on at battle of the bands mixed with some Jason Mraz and Jack Johnson.
author: April M.

description:
Get the crispy pad thai. Unique dish - haven't had anything like it in any place before.

Pretty inside, excellent service and a main course for $11. I will be back.
author: Varun V.

description:
I was very pleasantly surprised with this unassuming restaurant.  Located on a busy intersection, it is easy to miss....but once you find a parking space, it is definitely worth trying it out.

It's very open, airy, simple yet elegant dining space is suitable for dinner with a friend or even a group of friends.

Everyone in the restaurant was very friendly, greeted you with a smile and a  hello.  Our server, Mita, was exceptionally friendly, helpful, and easy to talk to.  She was very attentive and returned once or twice making sure we have enough water and asking us how everything is.

My friend had the Crispy Chicken and I had a taste of it. It was just wonderful!  I will be sure to order that dish next time I return...which I hope is soon!  I had the Pad Thai (combination...chicken, shrimp).  

Both dishes came very quickly, and were nicely done.  They were very tasteful and worth every penny.

My friend and I were glad to get there early enough (Saturday, 6:30ish)....by the time we left, people were coming in and it was getting fairly crowded.

So, if you're looking for a new Thai Restaurant in the Mission....if you live close by...just walk on over.  If you are driving, allow yourself some time to find a parking space (especially if it's a weekend).....but definitely worth it!  This is the ONLY reason why I did not give it a full 5 stars.  I really want to give 4.5.... less 1/2 star for parking situation....but the food, ambience, and service are all 5 stars!!

Say hi to Mita for me!    I think she works mostly evenings..... :-)

Andy
author: Andy P.

description:
Ordered takeout on Grubhub at 8:45pm and two hours pass. I figure they're on their way here since they close at 10:30. Ehhhhh. Wrong. I call Grubhub to see what's the happs. They call the restaurant while I'm on hold. Turns out the driver's car broke down... Don't have any way to get my food to me.

They didn't feel the necessity to call? 

From the other reviews on here I can tell this place isn't going to stick around too long.
author: Christopher L.

description: Crispy Basil Chicken, highly recommended! Oooh and the desserts. All of them. The fried bananas and ice cream. The deep fried ice cream. Sadly other than the chicken, we haven't found anything else as good on the menu. The rest is good, but it's just okay.
author: Heather R.

description:
Food is meh.  (Chewy, iridescent beef)
Service is meh.  (OK, not awesome)
Ambiance is meh.  (Clean, modern decor but feels contrived)

With all of the great Thai restaurants in the city, take your business somewhere else.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
Email receipt shows an estimated delivery time of 30-45min.  It's now been 90 minutes and there is still no food here.  I called at 60min to check on status and they said the food would be right there and that the estimate should have been 70min.  At 80min, after calling 4x without getting an answer (just ringing on and on) they answered and said the food was about to leave.

I can't rate the quality of the food, but DO NOT ORDER delivery from this place if you actually want to eat your food in the next 90 minutes.
author: Darius M.

description:
Shameful and Unprofessional. DO NOT ORDER.

Put a delivery to them through Grubhub and it LITERALLY NEVER CAME. When we called to check up on the order once it was 20 minutes late (over an hour from when order was placed) they told us TO WAIT FOR THE FOOD, that it was coming, and they would credit us back our card to boot. More than fair, right? WRONG. Fast forward over two hours from placing the order -- and I'm famished and cooking myself, because the food NEVER CAME. Despite being respectful and even-tempered with them it was difficult to even curry an apology from them. Super unprofessional, totally shameful failure. Spend your money elsewhere.
author: Vincent C.

description:
Business hours have changed.  

Monday - closed
Tues - Sunday
Lunch 11-4, Dinner 5:30-10PM
author: Hiromi N.

description: So if you want average Thai food that's not worth the price, $50 for two people, 2 apps, 2 entrees, no wine or beer, come to Krua Thai.  With 5 wait staff and barely half the restaurant filled, one was busy checking is phone at the bar and our only white waiter, couldn't be bothered to check in on the food or service.  He took our order, and finally he dragged his ugly shorts and shirt that didn't match any of the other waitstaff uniform to pick up our plates after spending waaayyy too much time with his 'friends' who were average white women.
